description:
A lightweight utility that makes the Windows taskbar translucent/transparent.

A lightweight (uses a few MB of RAM and almost no CPU) utility that makes the Windows taskbar translucent/transparent on Windows 10 and Windows 11.
This release is signed with Azure Code Signing! Future releases will be using ACS as well. ACS creates short-lived certificates for signature so the thumbprint is not fixed, however the certificate subject will always be the same.
Bug fixes
- Fix portable builds not working if the TranslucentTB temporary directory didn't exist.
- Fix erroneous "Couldn't configure TAP to restore taskbar appearance once TranslucentTB dies." message in the log.
- Make Start opened, Search opened and Task View opened states work on newer builds of Windows 11.
- Fix crashes with GlazeWM and the Magnifier app.
- Increase the timeout for the XAML TAP to hopefully reduce the amount of "The wait operation timed out" and "Element not found" messages being seen.
Various improvements/changes
- Support for Ukrainian locale.
- Improvements to German and Chinese translations.
- This releases uses a new GUID for the tray icon, because the ACS certificate subject is different than the previous certificate. Due to this, your preferences related to the tray icon will be reset.
- Remove the ttb: protocol, as it was an experiment for something that didn't end up working.
